headline: D.R. Horton Balances Softer Revenue With Orders Growth And Cost Discipline
summary: D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) reported quarterly results that showed higher net sales orders even as revenue declined. The company leaned on sales incentives and tighter cost controls to support order volumes and margins. Management highlighted affordability pressures and changing buyer sentiment as key themes in the quarter. D.R. Horton, trading at $150.42, is operating in a housing market where affordability and sentiment are front and center for buyers. The stock is up 3.2% year to date and...
